client_profile: A couple seeking to buy an apartment in Brussels for EUR 490,000–895,000. Priorities include cafes, expat community, and quiet residential areas.
must_have: Proximity to cafes and brunch spots
Value for money in property options
nice_to_have: Access to parks and recreational areas
red_flags: High noise levels in certain districts
Long commuting times from some areas
Limited services for expats in neighborhoods
contradictions: Expats prioritize community but may face language barriers
Quiet areas may lack vibrant cafe culture
Desire for value may limit neighborhood options
Budget constraints may exclude some preferred districts

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Flagey Square hosts festivals, enhancing community engagement.
Proximity to diverse cafes aligns with expat lifestyle needs.
watch_out: Ixelles can experience high prices due to its popularity.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: The district is filled with international dining spots and cultural events.
Parc de Forest is perfect for those seeking quiet urban living.
watch_out: Saint-Gilles can experience high demand, impacting property availability.
